European ADRs Nudge Lower in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs Nudge Lower in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
September 1, 2020 Tuesday 11:18 AM EST
Copyright 2020 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 226 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.017% lower at 923.38 on the BNY Mellon Europe 
Select ADR Index on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by software firm Talend (TLND) and biopharmaceutical company 
ERYTECH Pharma (ERYP), which climbed 13% and 6.8% respectively. They were followed by dating app operator 
Spark Networks (LOV) and semiconductor company Sequans Communications (SQNS), which rose 5.9% and 
2.4%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biotech firm BioNTech (BNTX) and pharmaceutical company 
Ascendis Pharma (ASND), which fell 4.5% and 2.9% respectively. They were followed by telecommunications 
company VEON Ltd. (VEON) and hotel booking site trivago (TRVG), which were down 2.8% and 2.2%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by mining company BHP Group (BBL) and Trinity Biotech (TRIB), which 
rose 3.7% and 2.6% respectively. They were followed by mining company Rio Tinto Group (RIO) and airline 
operator Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY), which were up 1.6% and 1.5%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by pharmaceutical company Avadel Pharmaceuticals (AVDL) and 
biopharmaceutical company Amarin Corporation (AMRN), which lost 4.7% and 4% respectively. They were followed 
by biopharmaceutical company NuCana (NCNA) and communications group WPP plc (WPP), which fell 3.8% and 
3.4%.
Load-Date: September 1, 2020
End of Document
Ryanair raises â,¬400m through shares sale
Ryanair raises â,¬400m through shares sale
AirFinance Journal
September 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 271 words
Byline: Alex Derber
Body
Ryanair has placed about 35.2 million new ordinary shares at (EURO)11.35 ($13.46) per share, a discount of 2.6% 
on the company's closing price on 3 September.
The low-cost carrier wants to use the proceeds to capitalise on post-Covid-19 growth opportunities as other carriers 
fail or merge due to the crisis and to "de-risk" its debt repayments.
It is also looking to retain its BBB investment grade rating to "optimise" planned bond issuances in the near future, 
and expects the share placement to "further enhance" its liquidity position, which included (EURO)3.9 billion of cash 
on 30 June 2020.
The company has approximately (EURO)1.9 billion of debt maturing from March to June 2021, when it also plans to 
start receiving Boeing 737 Max 200 aircraft - potentially up to 40 units before the summer season.
"Prudent capital management through the Placing and the expected bond issuance will pre-fund the Group's 
balance sheet and enhance its financial flexibility as it continues to face a very challenging and uncertain 
operational environment," stated Ryanair.
The new shares represent approximately 3.2% of Ryanair's issued share capital immediately prior to the placing.
The (EURO)400 million share issue was placed by J&E Davy, which acted as sole bookrunner, and applications 
have been made for the admission of the new shares on Euronext Dublin as their primary listing and on the London 
Stock Exchange.
Settlement of the placing shares is expected to occur on 8 September.
Institutional investors, including new and existing shareholders, participated in the placement, as did certain of 
Ryanair's directors and management.
Load-Date: September 21, 2020
End of Document
Wizz Air slashes Hungarian network due to border closure
Wizz Air slashes Hungarian network due to border closure
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
September 01, 2020
Copyright 2020 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 298 words
Body
Wizz Air (W6, Budapest) has announced in a statement to Reuters that it would cut its network from Hungary to just 
32 weekly departures as of September 7, 2020, after the government announced the closure of the country to 
nearly all foreigners. The airline said that it would continue operating the most popular routes out of Hungary but 
that most of its services would be suspended between September 7 and 30. According to the ch-aviation schedules 
module, Wizz Air scheduled 358 departures out of Hungary in the week starting August 30, 2020, with a total of 
74,880 departure seats. The low-cost carrier serves Budapest and Debrecen in the country, operating international 
routes exclusively. 
Hungary is currently Wizz Air's fifth-largest origin market, after Poland, Romania, the United Kingdom, and Italy, 
with a 7.6% market share by departure capacity. Wizz Air is also by far the largest airline in Hungary at this time 
with a 59.9% market share by capacity. Ryanair (FR, Dublin Int'l), the second-ranked carrier, controls 18.8%. As of 
September 1, Hungary's borders will be closed to nearly all foreigners, except for a limited number of exceptions 
including essential workers and expatriates travelling on business involving Hungarian firms. All Hungarians 
returning home, regardless of their country of embarcation, will have to undergo a 14-day quarantine and test twice 
for COVID-19, all of which must be paid out of their own pockets.

across 
the

with

and

End of Document
Wizz Air slashes Hungarian network due to border closure
Wizz Air slashes Hungarian network due to border closure
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
September 01, 2020
Copyright 2020 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Airline Route Development News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 298 words
Body
Wizz Air (W6, Budapest) has announced in a statement to Reuters that it would cut its network from Hungary to just 
32 weekly departures as of September 7, 2020, after the government announced the closure of the country to 
nearly all foreigners. The airline said that it would continue operating the most popular routes out of Hungary but 
that most of its services would be suspended between September 7 and 30. According to the ch-aviation schedules 
module, Wizz Air scheduled 358 departures out of Hungary in the week starting August 30, 2020, with a total of 
74,880 departure seats. The low-cost carrier serves Budapest and Debrecen in the country, operating international 
routes exclusively. 
Hungary is currently Wizz Air's fifth-largest origin market, after Poland, Romania, the United Kingdom, and Italy, 
with a 7.6% market share by departure capacity. Wizz Air is also by far the largest airline in Hungary at this time 
with a 59.9% market share by capacity. Ryanair (FR, Dublin Int'l), the second-ranked carrier, controls 18.8%. As of 
September 1, Hungary's borders will be closed to nearly all foreigners, except for a limited number of exceptions 
including essential workers and expatriates travelling on business involving Hungarian firms. All Hungarians 
returning home, regardless of their country of embarcation, will have to undergo a 14-day quarantine and test twice 
for COVID-19, all of which must be paid out of their own pockets.

Ryanair logo State of Wisconsin Investment Board grew its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 
28.5% in the second quarter, HoldingsChannel  reports. The institutional investor  owned 187,685 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 41,601 shares during the period. State of Wisconsin 
Investment Board's holdings in Ryanair were worth $12,451,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
Other hedge funds have also made changes to their positions in the company. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. 
raised its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 178.6% in the 2nd quarter. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. now owns

in the last quarter.  Harbor Investment Advisory LLC increased its position in shares of  Ryanair by 11.2% during

worth $126,000 after purchasing an additional 191 shares in the last quarter.  Virtu Financial LLC acquired a new 
stake in shares of  Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth about $582,000.  State Street Corp increased its position in 
shares of  Ryanair by 21.9% during the 1st quarter. State Street Corp now owns 88,058 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $4,675,000 after purchasing an additional 15,821 shares in the last quarter.  Finally,

$212,000. Institutional investors own  44.15% of the company's stock.

shares of Ryanair in a research note on Friday, August 14th. Raymond James raised their target price on shares of 
Ryanair from $68.00 to $90.00 and gave the stock a "strong-buy" rating in a report on Thursday, July 30th.

Monday, July 13th. BidaskClub downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on 
Friday, August 21st. Finally, Zacks Investment Research  upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to 
a "buy" rating and set a $68.00 target price on the stock in a report on Tuesday, May 26th. Five analysts have rated 
the stock with a hold rating, twelve have issued  a buy rating and one  has assigned  a strong buy rating to the 
company. The company currently has a consensus rating of "Buy" and a consensus price target of $79.00.

and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $44.44 and a 12-month high of 
$96.79. The company has a market capitalization of $19.36 billion, a PE ratio of 30.17 and a beta of 1.35. The firm's 
50 day moving average is $76.58 and its 200-day moving average is $68.45.

:RYAAY)

company reported ($0.94) EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($1.15) by $0.21. The 
business had revenue of $137.83 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $138.60 
million. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  As a group, sell-side analysts expect 
that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -4.3 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Profile

United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair keeps EMTN programme at â,¬5bn
Ryanair keeps EMTN programme at â,¬5bn
AirFinance Journal
September 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 222 words
Byline: Olivier Bonnassies
Body
Irish carrier Ryanair has filed a new base prospectus for a (EURO)5 billion ($5.9 billion) medium-term note (EMTN) 
programme, but is yet to issue the unsecured bonds.
Citigroup Global Markets is the global coordinator of the programme.
BNP Paribas and Citigroup Global Markets are arrangers while 15 banks are acting as dealers in the programme. 
Those include Barclays Bank Ireland, Barclays Bank, BNP Paribas, Citigroup Global Markets Europe, Citigroup 
Global Markets, Commerzbank Aktiengesellschaft, Credit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Goldman 
Sachs International, ING Bank, J&E Davy, Natwest Markets, SMBC Nikko Capital Markets, SMBC Nikko Capital 
Markets Europe, Societe Generale and Standard Chartered Bank.   The Irish low-cost carrier established the EMTN 
programme last August and at the time S&P Global Ratings Europe and Fitch Ratings assigned BBB+ ratings.   In 
the new base prospectus, both agencies have assigned a BBB rating.
Ryanair last tapped the bond markets in early 2017 as part of its (EURO)3 billion EMTN programme.
The 6.5-year transaction priced at a fixed coupon of 1.125%. The joint bookrunners were BNP Paribas, Citigroup 
and Credit Agricole.
In March 2015, Ryanair issued an (EURO)850 million eight-year bond at 1.125%, at mid-swaps plus 67 basis points 
- setting a new record for the aviation industry.
Load-Date: September 21, 2020
End of Document
Ryanair to make Max move amid crisis: Davy
Ryanair to make Max move amid crisis: Davy
AirFinance Journal
September 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 283 words
Byline: Oliver Clark
Body
Ryanair could seek to take advantage of the current "market softness" to make a Boeing 737 Max order 
announcement, analysts at Davy have suggested.
Speaking to Airfinance Journal, Davy analyst Stephen Furlong said he expects the low-cost carrier to confirm 75 
Max options and reconfirm its existing 135 committed orders for a total of 210 orders.
"Basically a repricing of the existing deal and a new delivery schedule given delays," he comments.
Furlong and Davy analyst Ross Harvey state in a research note their belief that "lowest cost wins" and believe the 
ultra-low-cost-carrier (ULCC) models are the "structural leaders".
With the intra-European market contracting over the coming years, they expect Ryanair to grow into the "vacuum" 
this creates with lower airport costs, some staff savings and lower ownership, maintenance and rental costs.
Key to growth to 200 million passengers per annum over the next five or six years will be the 210 737 Max aircraft 
on order or allocated as options, with Ryanair having estimated that it will take delivery of 40 Max aircraft for service 
next summer.
Furlong and Harvey also note that Ryanair has reached agreement with most pilot and cabin crew unions.
They expect a "smaller, more concentrated" industry post-crisis with certain airlines such as Ryanair, and Wizz Air 
having gained market share.
Furlong and Harvey note that at the end of the SARS crisis, temperature screening was a "key factor" in returning 
the sector to normal.
"The industry needs to find the equivalent process to take us to when a Covid-19 vaccine is available - the goal we 
should have is an effective set of standard practices that can be implemented globally as required," they add.
Load-Date: October 5, 2020
Ryanair to make Max move amid crisis: Davy
End of Document

Investors pile into Ryanair 's â,¬850m Eurobond
Investors pile into Ryanair's â,¬850m Eurobond
AirFinance Journal
September 2020
Copyright 2020 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 159 words
Byline: Alex Derber
Body
Ryanair has issued a five-year, (EURO)850 million ($1 billion) Eurobond at a fixed coupon of 2.875% as part of its 
(EURO)3 billion medium-term note (EMTN) programme.
The low-cost carrier's chief financial officer, Neil Sorahan, described the issuance as "multiple times" 
oversubscribed.
Sources tells Airfinance Journal that the unsecured bond was 4.4 times oversubscribed.
The successful Eurobond financing followed a (EURO)400 million share placement earlier in September.
Joint bookrunners were Barclays, BNP Paribas and Citigroup.
Ryanair is rated BBB by both S&P and Fitch Ratings.
The bond will be listed on the Euronext Irish Stock Exchange.
In 2017, the low-cost carrier issued a 6.5-year bond worth (EURO)750 million at a fixed coupon of 1.125%.
The company has approximately (EURO)1.9 billion of debt maturing from March to June 2021, when it also plans to 
start receiving Boeing 737 Max 200 aircraft - potentially up to 40 units before the summer season.

British police arrest two terrorism suspects at London airport
British police arrest two terrorism suspects at London airport
dpa international (Englischer Dienst)
August 31, 2020 Monday 11:08 AM GMT
Copyright 2020 Deutsche Presse-Agentur All Rights Reserved
Length: 99 words
Dateline: London (dpa) - 
Body
British police have detained two men on suspicion of terrorism at London's Stansted airport after their arrival on 
Sunday.
The two men - a 34-year-old from Kuwait and a 48-year-old from Italy - had arrived on a Ryanair flight from Vienna, 
police said.
Two RAF Typhoon jet fighters were scrambled to intercept the passenger jet.
A Ryanair spokesman quoted by the Press Association news agency said the flight crew had been alerted to a 
"potential security threat on board."
Monday's Daily Express reported that "suspicious objects" were found in an onboard toilet, but did not offer further 
details.
Editorial contactsEditing by: Laura Dubois, +49 30 2852 31472, <international@dpa.com;
Load-Date: August 31, 2020
End of Document
British police release two after mobile phone found in plane toilet
British police release two after mobile phone found in plane toilet
dpa international (Englischer Dienst)
August 31, 2020 Monday 4:42 PM GMT
Copyright 2020 Deutsche Presse-Agentur All Rights Reserved
Length: 151 words
Byline: Silvia Kusidlo in London
Dateline: London (dpa) - 
Body
Two men have been released without charge following a security scare after a mobile phone was found in an 
airplane toilet, British police said on Monday.
The two - a 34-year-old Kuwaiti national and a 48-year-old Italian - were arrested after their arrival on Sunday on a 
Ryanair flight from Vienna at London's Stansted airport.
They were initially arrested on suspicion of terrorism.
The suspicious object that triggered the scare was a mobile phone, the Press Association news agency reported.
"We understandably take any reports of suspicious objects or behaviour on flights very seriously and thankfully on 
this occasion there was no cause for concern," said Andy Waldie of the Counter Terrorism Policing unit, PA 
reported.
Two RAF Typhoon jet fighters were scrambled to intercept the passenger jet.
A Ryanair spokesman had earlier said the flight crew had been alerted to a "potential security threat on board." 
Editorial contactsEditing by: Allison Williams, +49 30 285231472, international@dpa.com
Load-Date: August 31, 2020
End of Document

ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 2:10 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 57 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - A 'terrorism' case that saw an Italian and a Kuwaiti arrested at Stansted Airport Sunday proved 
to be a false alarm and the pair were released with apologies on Monday. A "potential" terror threat was reported 
aboard a Ryanair flight from Vienna and the two men were arrested once they landed at the airport northeast of 
London.

Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (3)
Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (3)
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 2:12 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 84 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - A 'terrorism' case that saw an Italian and a Kuwaiti arrested at Stansted Airport Sunday proved 
to be a false alarm and the pair were released with apologies on Monday. A "potential" terror threat was reported 
aboard a Ryanair flight from Vienna and the two men were arrested once they landed at the airport northeast of 
London. British anti-terrrorism police said the alarm raised by the crew of the plane, which was escorted down by 
two RAI Typhoons, had turned out to to be "groundless".

Italian , Kuwaiti arrested for terror at Stansted (3)
Italian, Kuwaiti arrested for terror at Stansted (3)
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 12:12 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 43 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - British anti-terrorism police said Monday they had arrested on Sunday night an Italian and a 
Kuwaiti at Stansted Airport. The Guardian reported that the Italian is 48 and the Kuwaiti 34. They were reportedly 
on a Ryanair flight from Vienna.

Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (4)
Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (4)
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 2:12 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 101 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - A 'terrorism' case that saw an Italian and a Kuwaiti arrested at Stansted Airport Sunday proved 
to be a false alarm and the pair were released with apologies on Monday. A "potential" terror threat was reported 
aboard a Ryanair flight from Vienna and the two men were arrested once they landed at the airport northeast of 
London. British anti-terrrorism police said the alarm raised by the crew of the plane, which was escorted down by 
two RAI Typhoons, had turned out to to be "groundless". An allegedly suspicious object found in one of he plane's 
toilets was found to have been innocuous.
Load-Date: August 31, 2020
End of Document
Italian , Kuwaiti arrested for terror at Stansted (5)
Italian, Kuwaiti arrested for terror at Stansted (5)
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 12:13 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 64 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - British anti-terrorism police said Monday they had arrested on Sunday night an Italian and a 
Kuwaiti at Stansted Airport. The Guardian reported that the Italian is 48 and the Kuwaiti 34. They were reportedly 
on a Ryanair flight from Vienna. The BBC said the flight was intercepted by Royal Air Force Typhoons following a 
report of an unspecified security threat on board.

Italian, Kuwaiti arrested for terror at Stansted (6); Plane from Vienna 
intercepted by RAF jects
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 12:15 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 64 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - British anti-terrorism police said Monday they had arrested on Sunday night an Italian and a 
Kuwaiti at Stansted Airport. The Guardian reported that the Italian is 48 and the Kuwaiti 34. They were reportedly 
on a Ryanair flight from Vienna. The BBC said the flight was intercepted by Royal Air Force Typhoons following a 
report of an unspecified security threat on board.

Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (5)
Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (5)
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 2:13 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 116 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - A 'terrorism' case that saw an Italian and a Kuwaiti arrested at Stansted Airport Sunday proved 
to be a false alarm and the pair were released with apologies on Monday. A "potential" terror threat was reported 
aboard a Ryanair flight from Vienna and the two men were arrested once they landed at the airport northeast of 
London. British anti-terrrorism police said the alarm raised by the crew of the plane, which was escorted down by 
two RAI Typhoons, had turned out to to be "groundless". An allegedly suspicious object found in one of he plane's 
toilets was found to have been innocuous. The Italia, aged 48, and the 34-year-old Kuwaiti, were released without 
charge, police said.
Load-Date: August 31, 2020
End of Document
Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (6) Arrested Italian , 48, and Kuwaiti , 34, get police apology
Stansted 'terror' case false alarm (6); Arrested Italian, 48, and Kuwaiti, 34, 
get police apology
ANSA English Corporate Service
August 31, 2020 Monday 2:15 PM CET
©Copyright 2020 ANSA All Rights Reserved
Length: 116 words
Dateline: ROME 
Body
(ANSA) - AUG 31 - A 'terrorism' case that saw an Italian and a Kuwaiti arrested at Stansted Airport Sunday proved 
to be a false alarm and the pair were released with apologies on Monday. A "potential" terror threat was reported 
aboard a Ryanair flight from Vienna and the two men were arrested once they landed at the airport northeast of 
London. British anti-terrrorism police said the alarm raised by the crew of the plane, which was escorted down by 
two RAI Typhoons, had turned out to to be "groundless". An allegedly suspicious object found in one of he plane's 
toilets was found to have been innocuous. The Italia, aged 48, and the 34-year-old Kuwaiti, were released without 
charge, police said.
Load-Date: August 31, 2020

Morgan Stanley Has $26.47 Million Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Morgan Stanley Has $26.47 Million Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
August 30, 2020 Sunday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 743 words
Body
Ryanair logo Morgan Stanley raised its stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 52.4% in the first 
quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). 
The firm owned 498,607 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 171,347 
shares during the period. Morgan Stanley owned approximately 0.22% of Ryanair worth $26,470,000 as of its most 
recent SEC filing.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA grew its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 3.8% during the 1st quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,499,216 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$451,224,000 after purchasing an additional 308,003 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. raised its stake 
in  Ryanair by 10.8% during the first quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,530,081 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $399,771,000 after acquiring an additional 732,578 shares in the last quarter.  Capital 
Research Global Investors raised its stake in  Ryanair by 430.1% during the first quarter. Capital Research Global 
Investors now owns 3,766,971 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $199,988,000 after acquiring an 
additional 3,056,407 shares in the last quarter.  Capital International Investors lifted its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 0.4% during the first quarter. Capital International Investors now owns 3,582,952 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $190,221,000 after acquiring an additional 15,500 shares during the 
period.  Finally, Immersion Capital LLP boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 26.6% in the 1st quarter. 
Immersion Capital LLP now owns 2,182,341 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $115,860,000 
after purchasing an additional 458,047 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors own  43.80% of the 
company's stock.  
NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $86.00 on Friday. The firm has a market capitalization of $19.45 billion, a price-to-
earnings ratio of 76.11 and a beta of 1.35. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $44.44 and a 1-year high of 
$96.79. The business's 50-day moving average price is $75.36 and its two-hundred day moving average price is 
$68.52. The company has a current ratio of 0.67, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings results on Monday, July 27th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.94) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping the Thomson Reuters' consensus 
estimate of ($1.15) by $0.21. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%. The business 
Morgan Stanley Has $26.47 Million Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
had revenue of $137.83 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $138.60 million.  Sell-
side analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -4.3 earnings per share for the current year.  
Several research analysts have recently commented on the company. UBS Group  reissued a "buy" rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, May 20th. Credit Suisse Group  reissued an "outperform" rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, July 28th. BidaskClub lowered Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a 
"hold" rating in a research note on Friday, August 21st. Barclays  reaffirmed an "overweight" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a report on Friday, August 14th. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. raised shares of Ryanair from a 
"neutral" rating to an "overweight" rating in a report on Monday, July 13th. Five analysts have rated the stock with a 
hold rating, twelve have issued  a buy rating and one  has assigned  a strong buy rating to the company's stock. 
Ryanair currently has an average rating of "Buy" and an average price target of $79.00. 
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) during the 2nd quarter, according to 
its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities &#38; Exchange Commission. The fund acquired 22,308 shares 
of the transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $1,480,000.  A number of other hedge funds and

acquiring an additional 458,047 shares during the last quarter. 43.80% of the stock is currently owned by 
institutional investors.  Ryanair stock[3] traded down $0.40 during mid-day trading on Friday, reaching $86.00. 
704,910 shares of the company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 391,004. The business has a 
fifty day moving average of $75.36 and a 200 day moving average of $68.52. The company has a debt-to-equity 
ratio of 0.60, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a current ratio of 0.67. The firm has a market cap of $19.45 billion, a P/E ratio 
of 30.32 and a beta of 1.35. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $44.44 and a 12-month high of $96.79.

65,348 Shares in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Bought by Teacher Retirement System of Texas
65,348 Shares in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) Bought by Teacher 
Retirement System of Texas
American Banking and Market News
August 29, 2020 Saturday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 772 words
Body
Ryanair logo Teacher Retirement System of Texas bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) in the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund bought 
65,348 shares of the transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $4,335,000.  
Other institutional investors and hedge funds also recently added to or reduced their stakes in the company. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 3.8% during the 1st quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,499,216 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$451,224,000 after acquiring an additional 308,003 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. boosted its 
position in shares of  Ryanair by 10.8% during the 1st quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,530,081 shares of 
the transportation company's stock worth $399,771,000 after acquiring an additional 732,578 shares in the last 
quarter.  Capital Research Global Investors boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 430.1% during the 1st 
quarter. Capital Research Global Investors now owns 3,766,971 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$199,988,000 after acquiring an additional 3,056,407 shares in the last quarter.  Capital International Investors 
boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 0.4% during the 1st quarter. Capital International Investors now owns 
3,582,952 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $190,221,000 after acquiring an additional 15,500 
shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Immersion Capital LLP boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 26.6% during 
the 1st quarter. Immersion Capital LLP now owns 2,182,341 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$115,860,000 after acquiring an additional 458,047 shares in the last quarter. 43.80% of the stock is owned by 
hedge funds and other institutional investors.  
RYAAY has been the subject of a number of research analyst reports. Morgan Stanley  reissued an "overweight" 
rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, July 28th. Raymond James upped their target price on 
Ryanair from $68.00 to $90.00 and gave the company a "strong-buy" rating in a research report on Thursday, July 
30th. Credit Suisse Group  reissued an "outperform" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, 
July 28th. Zacks Investment Research  raised Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $68.00 
target price for the company in a research report on Tuesday, May 26th. Finally, BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a 
"buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Friday, August 21st. Five equities research analysts have 
rated the stock with a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one  has issued  a strong buy rating to the 
company. Ryanair  has a consensus rating of "Buy" and an average target price of $79.00. 
65,348 Shares in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY) Bought by Teacher Retirement System of Texas
RYAAY  opened at $86.00 on Friday. The business has a 50 day moving average price of $75.36 and a two-
hundred day moving average price of $68.52. The company has a quick ratio of 0.67, a current ratio of 0.67 and a 
debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60. The company has a market cap of $19.45 billion, a PE ratio of 30.32 and a beta of 1.35. 
Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $44.44 and a 52 week high of $96.79.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings data on Monday, July 27th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.94) EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of ($1.15) by 
$0.21. The firm had revenue of $137.83 million during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $138.60 
million. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%.  As a group, sell-side analysts expect 
that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post -4.3 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Body
Ryanair logo William Blair Investment Management LLC acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) during the 2nd quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities & 
Exchange Commission. The fund acquired 22,308 shares of the transportation company's stock, valued at 
approximately $1,480,000.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently modified their holdings of the 
business. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA increased its stake in  Ryanair by 3.8% during the first quarter. 
Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 8,499,216 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$451,224,000 after acquiring an additional 308,003 shares during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. increased 
its stake in  Ryanair by 10.8% during the first quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,530,081 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $399,771,000 after acquiring an additional 732,578 shares during the last 
quarter.  Capital Research Global Investors increased its stake in  Ryanair by 430.1% during the first quarter. 
Capital Research Global Investors now owns 3,766,971 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$199,988,000 after acquiring an additional 3,056,407 shares during the last quarter.  Capital International Investors 
increased its stake in  Ryanair by 0.4% during the first quarter. Capital International Investors now owns 3,582,952 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $190,221,000 after acquiring an additional 15,500 shares during 
the last quarter.  Finally, Immersion Capital LLP increased its stake in  Ryanair by 26.6% during the first quarter. 
Immersion Capital LLP now owns 2,182,341 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $115,860,000 after 
acquiring an additional 458,047 shares during the last quarter. 43.80% of the stock is currently owned by 
institutional investors.  
Ryanair stock  traded down $0.40 during mid-day trading on Friday, reaching $86.00. 704,910 shares of the 
company were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 391,004. The business has a fifty day moving 
average of $75.36 and a 200 day moving average of $68.52. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60, a 
quick ratio of 0.67 and a current ratio of 0.67. The firm has a market cap of $19.45 billion, a P/E ratio of 30.32 and a 
beta of 1.35. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $44.44 and a 12-month high of $96.79.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, July 27th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.94) earnings per share for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of ($1.15) by $0.21. The 
company had revenue of $137.83 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $138.60 million.

(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 68.5% during the 2nd quarter, according to the company in its most recent Form 13F filing 
with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The fund owned 121,733 shares of the transportation company's 
stock after purchasing an additional 49,497 shares during the quarter. New York State Common Retirement Fund 
owned approximately 0.05% of Ryanair worth $8,076,000 as of its most recent filing with the Securities & Exchange 
Commission.

business. Harbor Investment Advisory LLC bought a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the first quarter worth 
approximately $91,000.  Tower Research Capital LLC TRC purchased a new stake in  Ryanair in the first quarter

$212,000.  Finally, US Bancorp DE lifted its stake in  Ryanair by 67.9% in the first quarter. US Bancorp DE now 
owns 4,263 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $227,000 after acquiring an additional 1,724 shares 
during the period. 43.80% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.

on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, July 28th. UBS Group  reissued a "buy" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research report on Wednesday, May 20th. Barclays  reissued an "overweight" rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research report on Friday, August 14th. BidaskClub lowered Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" 
rating in a research report on Friday, August 21st. Finally, Raymond James raised their price objective on Ryanair 
from $68.00 to $90.00 and gave the company a "strong-buy" rating in a research report on Thursday, July 30th. 
Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one  has given 
a strong buy rating to the company. The company  has an average rating of "Buy" and a consensus price target of 
$79.00.

high of $96.79. The stock has a 50-day moving average of $75.36 and a 200 day moving average of $68.52. The 
company has a market capitalization of $18.88 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 76.11 and a beta of 1.35. The 
company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a current ratio of 0.67.

company reported ($0.94) EPS for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of ($1.15) by $0.21. Ryanair had a 
return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%. The company had revenue of $137.83 million during the

Under the hood Uncertainty takes toll as airlines suffer their worst crisis; The prospect of second virus waves 
and a patchwork of state curbs are crippling car....
Under the hood Uncertainty takes toll as airlines suffer their worst crisis; 
The prospect of second virus waves and a patchwork of state curbs are 
crippling carriers' ability to forecast demand reliably
Financial Times (London, England)
August 29, 2020 Saturday
Edition 1, Asian Edition
Copyright 2020 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 9
Length: 224 words
Body
Airlines are in their worst crisis since the first commercial service began just over 100 years ago.
In the past week alone, American said it would cut 19,000 jobs, Qantas announced it would shed thousands more 
jobs, and Norwegian warned it needed another rescue package.
The prospect of second virus waves and state curbs are crippling airlines' ability to forecast demand - jarring for a 
sector that requires reliable projections.
"You are getting airlines going from zero to 70 per cent capacity in the blink of an eye then having to ramp back 
down," said Mark Manduca, analyst at Citi.
Domestic passenger numbers in some markets have slowly started to recover from lockdown lows, especially in 
Asia. Air travel in China has fully returned to its pre-Covid levels. Japan has resumed normal service. Domestic 
travel is not subject to the same level of curbs, leaving it well positioned to lead any recovery.
Yet international travel remains adrift. The US has scheduled only a fifth of the seats used at the start of the year, 
while Vietnam - after a fresh outbreak - has cut capacity 90 per cent.
Europe's airlines have the challenge of navigating a patchwork of state rules, including quarantine restrictions.
Under the hood Uncertainty takes toll as airlines suffer their worst crisis; The prospect of second virus waves 
and a patchwork of state curbs are crippling car....
Ryanair has dialled down its schedule for September and October, blaming a resurgence of virus cases in parts of 
Europe. Philip Georgiadis
Load-Date: August 28, 2020
End of Document

and a patchwork of state curbs are crippling carr....

Norwegian Air Shuttle Calls for More Government Financial Support to Survive Impact of COVID-19 on Global 
Aviation Industry
Norwegian Air Shuttle Calls for More Government Financial Support to 
Survive Impact of COVID-19 on Global Aviation Industry
MT Newswires Live Briefs PRO
August 28, 2020 Friday 8:06 AM EST
Copyright 2020 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 406 words
Body
 Norwegian Air Shuttle (NAS.OL), a low-cost carrier, said on Friday that it reported a wider loss in the first half and 
called for more financial support from the state to help get it through the severe impact of the COVID-19 pandemic 
on the aviation industry.  
The company is facing "challenging times ahead" and the 3 billion Norwegian kroner ($341 million) support that it 
received earlier this year in the form of guaranteed loans "is not enough to get through this prolonged crisis," 
Norway's flagship carrier said in its earnings statement.
The group reported a net operating loss of 5.08 billion Norwegian kroner versus a loss of 836 million a year ago as 
a slump in the number of passengers flown pushed sales lower to 7.14 billion Norwegian kroner from 20.17 billion 
Norwegian kroner a year earlier. Most firms needed support to survive amid the hit to travel and tourism and have 
received "considerable" liquidity from their respective governments, it said.
"We are thankful for the loan guarantee made available to us by the Norwegian government which we worked hard 
to obtain," Chief Executive Jacob Schram said. "However, given the current market conditions, it is not enough to 
get through this prolonged crisis."
Norwegian reopened 76 routes on July 1, putting an additional 15 aircraft into service and bringing back more than 
600 staff to work. That compares with the grounding of 140 aircraft and furloughing or laying off about 8,000 
employees at the height of the crisis when strict government advice on travel decimated demand. In the second 
quarter, Norwegian operated seven to eight aircraft on domestic routes.
The firm said a high degree of uncertainty it is seeing in the market was mainly the result of "changing travel advice 
from governments across Europe," which in turn has an immediate impact on demand.
Norwegian Air Shuttle Calls for More Government Financial Support to Survive Impact of COVID-19 on Global 
Aviation Industry
The UK's Department of Transport and the Foreign and Commonwealth Office said in a statement on Thursday that 
Switzerland, the Czech Republic and Jamaica have been removed from its list of travel corridors for England as 
data showed a "significant increase" in confirmed COVID-19 cases.
Ireland's Ryanair (RYAAY), the biggest European budget airline said earlier this year coronavirus crisis has sparked 
a multi-billion "flood" of state aid from European Union governments to their flag carriers and called on the German 
government to "scrap" 9 billion euros ($10.64 billion) of financial support to Lufthansa.

End of Document

(NASDAQ:RYAAY)

Aug 28, 2020( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Natixis Advisors L.P. 
Increases Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) August 28th, 2020 - Comments Off on Natixis 
Advisors L.P. Increases Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) - Filed Under[1] - by Kyle Jackson[2]   
Natixis Advisors L.P. boosted its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 3.7% during the 
second quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 123,751 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after buying an additional 4,362 shares during the period. Natixis Advisors L.P.'s 
holdings in Ryanair were worth $8,210,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  A number of other large investors 
also recently modified their holdings of the business. 
Teacher Retirement System of Texas purchased a new position in Ryanair during the second quarter worth about 
$4,335,000. GAM Holding AG acquired a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth 
approximately $2,488,000. Avalon Investment &#38; Advisory raised its position in shares of Ryanair by 45.5% 
during the 2nd quarter. Avalon Investment &#38; Advisory now owns 18,391 shares of the transportation company's 
stock valued at $1,220,000 after buying an additional 5,754 shares during the period. Virtu Financial LLC acquired a 
new position in Ryanair in the second quarter valued at approximately $582,000. Finally, PNC Financial Services 
Group Inc. grew its position in Ryanair by 23.5% in the second quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now 
owns 958 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $64,000 after acquiring an additional 182 shares 
during the period. Institutional investors own 43.80% of the company's stock.  RYAAY has been the topic of a 
number of research analyst reports. Barclays restated an 'overweight' rating on shares of Ryanair in a research 
report on Friday, August 14th. Zacks Investment Research[3] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a 'strong sell' rating 
to a 'buy' rating and set a $68.00 price objective on the stock in a report on Tuesday, May 26th. Raymond James 
increased their target price on shares of Ryanair from $68.00 to $90.00 and gave the stock a 'strong-buy' rating in a 
research note on Thursday, July 30th. Credit Suisse Group reissued an 'outperform' rating on shares of Ryanair in a 
research note on Tuesday, July 28th. Finally, UBS Group reaffirmed a 'buy' rating on shares of Ryanair in a 
research report on Wednesday, May 20th. Five investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating, twelve 
have assigned a buy rating and one has issued a strong buy rating to the company. The stock currently has an 
average rating of 'Buy' and an average price target of $79.00.  Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY[4] traded up $2.02 
during midday trading on Friday, hitting $86.40. The company's stock had a trading volume of 608,367 shares, 
compared to its average volume of 421,439. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60, a current ratio of 0.67 
and a quick ratio of 0.67. The firm has a market capitalization of $18.88 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 76.46

and a beta of 1.35. The business's fifty day simple moving average is $74.97 and its two-hundred day simple 
moving average is $68.55. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1 year low of $44.44 and a 1 year high of $96.79. Ryanair

Natixis Advisors L.P. Raises Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
Natixis Advisors L.P. Raises Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
August 28, 2020 Friday
Copyright 2020 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 747 words
Body
Ryanair logo Natixis Advisors L.P. boosted its stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 3.7% in the 2nd 
quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission. The 
firm owned 123,751 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 4,362 shares 
during the quarter. Natixis Advisors L.P. owned approximately 0.05% of Ryanair worth $8,210,000 as of its most 
recent filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission.  
A number of other hedge funds also recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings 
Inc. boosted its holdings in  Ryanair by 178.6% in the 2nd quarter. Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Holdings Inc. now owns 
52,627 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $3,491,000 after purchasing an additional 33,738 
shares during the period.  Harbor Investment Advisory LLC grew its position in  Ryanair by 11.2% in the 2nd 
quarter. Harbor Investment Advisory LLC now owns 1,904 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$126,000 after acquiring an additional 191 shares during the last quarter.  State Street Corp increased its stake in  
Ryanair by 21.9% in the first quarter. State Street Corp now owns 88,058 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $4,675,000 after purchasing an additional 15,821 shares during the period.  Virtu Financial LLC 
purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the second quarter valued at $582,000.  Finally, Dynamic 
Technology Lab Private Ltd purchased a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the first quarter valued at 
$212,000. 43.80% of the stock is owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  
Shares of RYAAY stock  traded up $2.02 during mid-day trading on Friday, hitting $86.40. 608,367 shares of the 
stock traded hands, compared to its average volume of 421,439. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $44.44 
and a 52-week high of $96.79. The stock has a market cap of $18.88 billion, a P/E ratio of 76.46 and a beta of 1.35. 
The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60, a current ratio of 0.67 and a quick ratio of 0.67. The stock's fifty day 
moving average is $74.97 and its two-hundred day moving average is $68.55.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, July 27th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.94) EPS for the quarter, beating the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($1.15) by $0.21. Ryanair had a net 
margin of 3.61% and a return on equity of 10.45%. The company had revenue of $137.83 million during the quarter, 
compared to analysts' expectations of $138.60 million.  As a group, equities analysts forecast that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post -4.3 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
Several research analysts recently issued reports on the company. Morgan Stanley  reissued an "overweight" rating 
on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, July 28th. Barclays  restated an "overweight" rating on shares 
Natixis Advisors L.P. Raises Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( NASDAQ :RYAAY)
of Ryanair in a research note on Friday, August 14th. BidaskClub downgraded Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a 
"hold" rating in a report on Friday, August 21st. Zacks Investment Research  upgraded shares of Ryanair from a 
"strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $68.00 target price on the stock in a report on Tuesday, May 26th. 
Finally, Raymond James raised their target price on shares of Ryanair from $68.00 to $90.00 and gave the 
company a "strong-buy" rating in a research report on Thursday, July 30th. Five investment analysts have rated the 
stock with a hold rating, twelve have given a buy rating and one  has issued  a strong buy rating to the company. 
The company currently has an average rating of "Buy" and a consensus price target of $79.00. 
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Friday 28 Aug 2020
Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Friday 28 Aug 2020
Newstex Blogs 
The Week UK
August 28, 2020 Friday 6:05 AM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 732 words
Byline: chas
Body
Aug 28, 2020( The Week UK: http://www.theweek.co.uk Delivered by Newstex)  Trump says Biden is 'destroyer of 
American greatness' Donald Trump has warned that Joe Biden will 'demolish' the American dream if he wins the 
White House. Speaking on the final night of the Republican convention, the US president depicted his challenger as 
'the destroyer of American greatness' and claimed the Democrats would give free rein to 'violent anarchists'. The 
election campaign is 'widely expected to be one of the ugliest in living memory', says the BBC.   Care homes' death 
tolls hidden 'for commercial reasons' Coronavirus death tolls at individual care homes are being kept secret by 
regulators to protect providers' commercial interests before a possible second wave, reports The Guardian. 
England's Care Quality Commission and the Care Inspectorate in Scotland are refusing to disclose which homes or 
providers recorded the most fatalities because they fear that the supply of beds and standards of care could be 
threatened if customers deserted badly hit operators.   Conservatives tell Boris to get Britain back to workplaces 
Boris Johnson is under pressure from senior Tory MPs to give a 'clear and consistent message' that it is safe for 
people to go back to work. There have been warnings of 'devastating consequences' for town and city centres as 
analysis of mobile phone data shows that just 17% of workers have returned to their offices, no more than at the 
end of June.   Hurricane Laura downgraded after killing six in Louisiana Six people have died afterHurricane Laura 
hitLouisiana, felling trees and damaging buildings. The Category 4 storm arrived yesterday morning near the Texas 
border, tearing off roofs and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands. However, the expected 20ft (6m) storm 
surge was avoided and Laura has now been downgraded to tropical storm status.   BMJ says Covid risk to 
schoolchildren is 'tiny' The British Medical Journal says parents should be 'reassured' that Covid-19 has not caused 
the deaths of any otherwise healthy children in the UK. Researchers looked at 651 children with coronavirus in 
hospitals and found that children's risk of needing hospital treatment for coronavirus is 'tiny' and critical care 'even 
tinier'. The news comes as English schoolsprepare to open next week.   Staff in hazmat suits rush Covid passenger 
off Ryanair flight Officials in full PPE swept on board a Ryanair flight moments before it departed from London to 
remove a passenger who had tested positive for Covid-19. The passenger had received a text from test and trace 
minutes before departure, informing him that he had the virus. Ryanair said: 'The passenger and his travel 
companion were immediately offloaded and taken to a Stansted airport isolation area.'   Banksy finances boat to 
rescue refugees in the Mediterranean The street artist Banksy has funded a boat to rescue refugees attempting to 
reach Europe from north Africa. Named Louise Michel after a French feminist anarchist, the boat set off on 18 
August from the Spanish seaport of Burriana, near Valencia, and is now in the central Mediterranean. It has so far 
Ten Things You Need to Know Today: Friday 28 Aug 2020
rescued 89 people in distress, including 14 women and four children.   British children 'the least happy in Europe' 
Researchers have blamed a 'particularly British fear of failure' for their finding that more than a third of 15-year-olds 
here have low scores for life satisfaction, making them the unhappiest in Europe. The annual Good Childhood 
Report found that UK children were dissatisfied with schools, friends and their sense of purpose.   Harry Maguire 
says he thought he was being kidnapped The footballer Harry Maguire said he feared for his life when Greek police 
arrested him last week because he thought he was being kidnapped. Speaking to the BBC, the Manchester United 
and England defender claimed that plain-clothed police officers, who did not identify themselves, pulled over his 
group's minibus in Mykonos, threw him off the bus and struck him on his legs.   Conservationist killed by lions he 
hand-reared A 69-year-old South African conservationist has been killed by the lions he raised. West Mathewson 
was walking two white lionesses when one of the animals attacked and killed him without warning at the Lion Tree 
Top Lodge, in northern Limpopo province. Mathewson, known as 'Uncle West', had reare the lions from cubs.

Malta 's Lauda Europe to launch in late 3Q20
Malta's Lauda Europe to launch in late 3Q20
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
August 27, 2020
Copyright 2020 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 239 words
Body
Lauda Europe (Malta Int'l) has scheduled its launch for September 13, 2020, with its inaugural flight tentatively 
planned from Palma de Mallorca to Memmingen, analysis of parent Ryanair's internet booking engine shows. 
Ryanair Holdings' new Maltese subsidiary is due to replace Lauda (OE, Vienna), which is slated for closure. Lauda 
Europe will take over the operation of A320-200s from Lauda and will exclusively operate as a technical wet-lease 
operator under Ryanair's "FR" code. As of August 26, 2020, Lauda Europe has yet to receive its Maltese Air 
Operator's Certificate. As such, none of Lauda's aircraft have been transferred to the Maltese register so far. The 
Austrian airline, the sole Airbus operator within Ryanair Holdings, currently has a fleet of thirty A320-200s and has 
no plans to increase it beyond this number in the near term. Ryanair declined to confirm that Lauda Europe would 
launch on September 13. In a statement to ch-aviation, the LCC only relayed its earlier press release saying that 
Lauda Europe would be operational by the start of the winter 2021/22 season.

across

Ryanair logo Polaris Capital Management LLC increased its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 2.9% during the 2nd quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the 
Securities & Exchange Commission. The institutional investor  owned 1,443,400 shares of the transportation 
company's stock after buying an additional 40,900 shares during the period. Ryanair accounts for approximately  
4.7% of Polaris Capital Management LLC's holdings, making the stock its 6th biggest holding. Polaris Capital 
Management LLC owned about 0.64% of Ryanair worth $95,755,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors also recently modified their holdings of the stock. 
Capital Research Global Investors raised its holdings in  Ryanair by 430.1% during the 1st quarter. Capital 
Research Global Investors now owns 3,766,971 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $199,988,000 
after purchasing an additional 3,056,407 shares during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. raised its holdings in  
Ryanair by 10.8% during the 1st quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 7,530,081 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $399,771,000 after purchasing an additional 732,578 shares during the last quarter.

owns 2,182,341 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $115,860,000 after purchasing an additional 
458,047 shares during the last quarter.  Invesco Ltd. raised its holdings in  Ryanair by 28.0% during the 1st quarter. 
Invesco Ltd. now owns 1,589,509 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $84,387,000 after purchasing 
an additional 347,317 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Royal Bank of Canada raised its holdings in  Ryanair 
by 22.9% during the 1st quarter. Royal Bank of Canada now owns 1,664,426 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $88,364,000 after purchasing an additional 310,399 shares during the last quarter. 
Institutional investors and hedge funds own  43.80% of the company's stock.  
NASDAQ RYAAY  traded up $2.02 during trading hours on Thursday, reaching $86.40. 608,367 shares of the 
company's stock were exchanged, compared to its average volume of 725,152. The company's 50-day moving 
average is $74.62 and its two-hundred day moving average is $68.59. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of 
$44.44 and a one year high of $96.79. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.60, a quick ratio of 0.67 and a 
current ratio of 0.67. The company has a market capitalization of $19.45 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 76.46 
and a beta of 1.35.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, July 27th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.94) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts' consensus estimates of ($1.15) by

$0.21. Ryanair had a return on equity of 10.45% and a net margin of 3.61%. The business had revenue of $137.83 
million during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $138.60 million.  Research analysts predict that  
Ryanair Holdings plc will post -4.3 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.  
RYAAY has been the subject of several recent research reports. Zacks Investment Research  raised Ryanair from a 
"strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $68.00 price objective for the company in a report on Tuesday, May 
26th. UBS Group  reaffirmed a "buy" rating on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Wednesday, May 20th. 
BidaskClub cut Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Friday, August 21st. Morgan

price target of $79.00. 
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Dublin Airport COVID 19 Airline Update
Dublin Airport COVID 19 Airline Update
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com

Ryanair's (RYA) Buy Rating Reiterated at UBS Group
Ryanair's (RYA) Buy Rating Reiterated at UBS Group
Newstex Blogs 
Week Herald
August 27, 2020 Thursday 6:06 AM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 329 words
Body
Aug 
27, 
2020( 
Week 
Herald: 
https://weekherald.com 
Delivered 
by 
Newstex)  
https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.pngUBS Group reaffirmed their buy rating on shares of 
Ryanair (LON:RYA) in a research note issued to investors on Monday, Borsen Zeitung[1] reports.RYA has been the 
topic of several other reports. 
Morgan Stanley reiterated a buy rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Wednesday, May 27th. Liberum Capital 
reiterated an under review rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Monday, July 27th. One analyst has rated the 
stock with a sell rating and three have issued a buy rating to the company. The company currently has a consensus 
rating of Buy and an average target price of GBX 13 ($0.17).Shares of RYA[2] opened at GBX 12.41 ($0.16) on 
Monday. The company has a market cap of $135.22 million and a price-to-earnings ratio of 61.46. Ryanair has a 1-
year low of GBX 8.05 ($0.11) and a 1-year high of GBX 16.97 ($0.22). The company's fifty day simple moving 
average is GBX 11.18 and its 200 day simple moving average is GBX 61.24. The company has a current ratio of 
0.67, a quick ratio of 0.60 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 103.04. Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, 
together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and 
Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-
flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and 
marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Featured Article:

Ryanair (LON:RYA) Receives 'Buy' Rating from UBS Group
Ryanair (LON:RYA) Receives 'Buy' Rating from UBS Group
Newstex Blogs 
Watchlist News
August 25, 2020 Tuesday 9:30 AM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 593 words
Body
Aug 25, 2020( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (LON:RYA) 
Receives 'Buy' Rating from UBS Group August 25th, 2020 - Comments Off on Ryanair (LON:RYA) Receives 'Buy' 
Rating from UBS Group - Filed Under[1] - by Lindsey Winhoffer[2]   
https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.pngUBS Group reaffirmed their buy rating on shares of 
Ryanair (LON:RYA) in a research report released on Monday morning, Borsen Zeitung[3] reports. A number of 
other equities analysts also recently commented on RYA. Liberum Capital reissued an under review rating on 
shares of Ryanair in a research report on Monday, July 27th. Morgan Stanley reissued a buy rating on shares of 
Ryanair in a research report on Wednesday, May 27th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating 
and three have assigned a buy rating to the stock. Ryanair presently has a consensus rating of Buy and an average 
target price of GBX 13 ($0.17). Shares of Ryanair stock[4] opened at GBX 11.85 ($0.15) on Monday. Ryanair has a 
one year low of GBX 8.05 ($0.11) and a one year high of GBX 16.97 ($0.22). The company has a market cap of 
$129.12 million and a PE ratio of 57.54. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 103.04, a quick ratio of 0.60 and 
a current ratio of 0.67. The business has a 50-day simple moving average of GBX 11.15 and a 200-day simple 
moving average of GBX 75.98.   Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, 
provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The 
company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and 
Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation 
services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website. Recommended Story: What is Green

Ryanair pay deals with crew mean fewer job cuts
Ryanair pay deals with crew mean fewer job cuts
Airguide Business & AirguideBusiness.com
August 25, 2020
Copyright 2020 Pyramid Media Group Inc. All Rights Reserved
Section: Air and Travel Business News; ISSN: 1939-666X
Length: 350 words
Body
Having struck deals with unions representing pilots and cabin crew across Europe, Ryanair (FR, Dublin Int'l) now 
expects to cut "significantly" fewer jobs than the 3,000 it originally estimated, its director of operations Neal 
McMahon has told Reuters. Overall, he said during an interview on August 21, 97% of pilots and more than 90% of 
cabin crew have so far agreed to take pay cuts and changes to employment terms. At the beginning of May, the 
airline warned it may have to institute cost cuts that could result in the loss of up to 3,000 mainly pilot and cabin 
crew jobs - one in five of its flight crew personnel - if they did not accept wage reductions of up to 20%. But on 
August 20, Spanish pilots accepted a 20% pay cut and work practice changes. 
Although cabin crew there refused to join the pilots in the agreement, the collective bargaining system in Spain 
allows Ryanair to implement the changes anyway. That leaves agreements outstanding with cabin crew in both Italy 
and Germany and pilots in Belgium. "We haven't finalised the number yet. We originally said there was going to be 
3,000 redundancies, but we have been able to reduce that significantly," McMahon told Reuters. "Broadly speaking, 
they recognise the grim situation we are in and they have been pragmatic." According to Ryanair's human 
resources director Darrell Hughes, the cabin crew union in Italy has put a deal to a vote, negotiations with flight 
attendants continue in Germany, and discussions on a collective redundancy process for pilots in Belgium are 
ongoing. Ryanair has, so far, managed to sustain pilot numbers without redundancies by deploying a mix of 
voluntary part-time work, voluntary unpaid leave, and spreading shifts more widely, McMahon and Hughes said.

Bitcoin is worth 8,000 but Ryanair 's CEO believes it should be worth zero
Bitcoin is worth 8,000 but Ryanair's CEO believes it should be worth zero
Newstex Blogs 
Business Matters
August 25, 2020 Tuesday 3:06 PM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 636 words
Byline: Business Matters
Body
Aug 
25, 
2020( 
Business 
Matters: 
http://www.bmmagazine.co.uk/ 
Delivered 
by 
Newstex)  
https://www.bmmagazine.co.uk/news/bitcoin-is-worth-8000-but-ryanairs-ceo-believes-it-should-be-worth-zero/One 
bitcoin currently costs around 8,000, but if you ask Michael O'Leary, it's dramatically overvalued.The Ryanair chief 
executive has voiced his disapproval of bitcoin, which he likens to a ponzi scheme, and expressed the belief that 
the cryptocurrency is an unsound investment. O'Leary's comments[1] come in the wake of a crypto scam called 
Bitcoin Lifestyle that used a fake endorsement by him to promote the fraud. 
Despite Bitcoin Lifestyle having no connection with bitcoin (BTC) or with O'Leary, it hasn't stopped Ryanair's senior 
exec from taking aim at bitcoin and everything it represents. As anyone who's checked the BTC price chart[2] lately 
will attest, however, bitcoin holds significant value to the millions of people who use it as a store of value, means of 
cross-border exchange, pseudonymous currency, and speculative asset. Bitcoin is up 60% for the year to date and 
many analysts are predicting it to reach new all-time highs within the next 12 months.O'Leary Wouldn't Invest a 
Cent in BitcoinRiled by his likeness being used to flog a knock-off version of bitcoin, O'Leary has vowed 'I have 
never, and would never, invest one cent in Bitcoin, which I believe is equivalent to a Ponzi scheme I would strongly 
advise everyone with any shred of common sense to ignore this false story and avoid Bitcoin like a plague.' 
Ryanair's CEO is one of Ireland's richest men[3] and an entrepreneur whose business acumen speaks for itself. At 
59, however, he is significantly older than the average bitcoin enthusiast, and can be forgiven for failing to 
understand its value proposition. Unfortunately, the first interaction that many British public figures including Michael 
O'Leary, Simon Cowell, Sir Philip Green, Holly Willoughby, Lord Sugar, and Jeremy Clarkson have with bitcoin is 
discovering they've been used to promote crypto scams they have supposedly endorsed and profited from. With a 
net worth of 800 million, O'Leary has no need for speculating in highly volatile crypto assets. He's already made it, 
and thus can afford to be dismissive of bitcoin. He's certainly not the only HNW individual to have written off bitcoin 
out of hand. Billionaire Warren Buffett memorably called[4] bitcoin 'rat poison squared' and his stance on 
cryptocurrencies doesn't appear to have softened, even after attending a charity lunch with several crypto 
influencers including Justin Sun, the founder of the TRON blockchain and cryptocurrency.Where There's Money, 
There's ScammersWhy bitcoin is not, in any classic sense, a ponzi scheme, its meteoric rise in value over the past 
decade has attracted scammers. From Twitter giveaway scams, like the one that saw celebrity accounts 
commandeered by a teenage hacker, to fake news sites promoting Bitcoin Lifestyle with the 'endorsement' of 
Michael O'Leary, scammers have been lured to bitcoin like bees to honey. While their efforts have served to taint 
Bitcoin is worth 8,000 but Ryanair 's CEO believes it should be worth zero
bitcoin's name, they haven't diminished the function it was designed for, and which it still faithfully serves: 
uncensorable digital cash for the digital generation. Read more: Bitcoin is worth 8,000 but Ryanair's CEO believes it 
should be worth zero[5] [ 1]: https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/michael-oleary-denounces-bitcoin-lifestyle-scam-
that-uses-his-image-3fk637n5x

2]: 
https://cryptopotato.com/bitcoin-price-analysis/

Satoshi Nakaboto: ' Ryanair CEO believes Bitcoin is a ponzi scheme'
Satoshi Nakaboto: 'Ryanair CEO believes Bitcoin is a ponzi scheme'
Newstex Blogs 
TheNextWeb.com
August 25, 2020 Tuesday 9:07 AM EST
Copyright 2020 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 628 words
Byline: Satoshi Nakaboto
Body
Aug 25, 2020( TheNextWeb.com: http://thenextweb.com Delivered by Newstex)  Our robot colleague Satoshi 
Nakaboto writes about Bitcoin BTC[1] every fucking day. Welcome to another edition of Bitcoin Today, where I, 
Satoshi Nakaboto, tell you what's been going on with Bitcoin in the past 24 hours. As Marcus Aurelius used to say: 
Yippee!
 Bitcoin priceWe closed the day, August 24 2020, at a price of $11,774. That's a minor 0.95 percent increase in 24 
hours, or $110. It was the highest closing price in three days. We're still 41 percent below Bitcoin's all-time high of 
$20,089 (December 17 2017).Bitcoin market capBitcoin's market cap ended the day at $217,477,962,650. It now 
commands 61 percent of the total crypto market.Bitcoin volumeYesterday's volume of $20,681,511,755 was the 
highest in two days, 9 percent below last year's average, and 72 percent below last year's high.That means that 
yesterday, the Bitcoin network shifted the equivalent of 334 tons of gold.Bitcoin transactionsA total of 328,984 
transactions were conducted yesterday, which is 2 percent above last year's average and 27 percent below last 
year's high.Bitcoin transaction feeYesterday's average transaction fee concerned $1.58. That's $2.32 below last 
year's high of $3.91.Bitcoin distribution by addressAs of now, there are 18,729 Bitcoin millionaires, or addresses 
containing more than $1 million worth of Bitcoin. Furthermore, the top 10 Bitcoin addresses house 4.9 percent of 
the total supply, the top 100 14.2 percent, and the top 1000 34.8 percent.Company with a market cap closest to 
BitcoinWith a market capitalization of $216 billion, Merck &#38; Co has a market capitalization most similar to that 
of Bitcoin at the moment.Bitcoin's path towards $1 millionOn November 29 2017 notorious Bitcoin evangelist John 
McAfee predicted[2] that Bitcoin would reach a price of $1 million by the end of 2020. He even promised to eat his 
own dick if it doesn't. Unfortunately for him it's 97.8 percent behind being on track. Bitcoin's price should have been 
$536K by now, according to dickline.info.Bitcoin energy consumptionOn a yearly basis Bitcoin now uses an 
estimated 67 terawatt hour of electricity. That's the equivalent of Czech Republic's energy consumption.Bitcoin on 
TwitterYesterday 32,820 fresh tweets about Bitcoin were sent out into the world. That's 60.5 percent above last 
year's average. The maximum amount of tweets per day last year about Bitcoin was 82,838.Most popular posts 
about BitcoinThis was yesterday's most engaged tweet about Bitcoin:Ryanair CEO Micheal O'Leary said 'I have 
never, and would never, invest one cent in Bitcoin' which he likens to a Ponzi scheme https://t.co/DjFNXkECsc[3] — 
Cointelegraph (@Cointelegraph) August 24, 2020[4] This was yesterday's most upvoted Reddit post about Bitcoin: 
Another company announces it is buying bitcoin as capital allocation strategy.[5] from r/Bitcoin[6]And this was 
yesterday's top submission on Hacker News about Bitcoin: Why I'm Putting All My Savings into Bitcoin (2011)
